result.execSummary:
The defendant Maurice Allen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.  Sentence credit for 46 days were granted.

miscConds.notes: Restitution to be paid in the amount of $166.50 to the following:  $120.00 to Pawn America and $46.50 to Media X-Change.  Bail applied to restitution.  Paid in full.
Bail applied to costs/surcharge.  Paid in full.  Remainder of bail to be refunded to poster.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Sign Medical Release for Agent.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommeded by Agent.

No contact with Shawna P., Zachary K., Joshua O., Travis S. or any pawn shops.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Straight time.  Last 40 days STAYED for use at Agent's discretion.

Defendant Maurice  Allen in court, in custody, with attorney Nicholas Martinez.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Martinez makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  Court orders all cashbail be reinstated and be applied towards restitutuion and costs.  
The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1.  

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:

30 months Imprisonment (Credit -46 days)
15 months of Initial Confinement
15 months of Extended Supervision

Term of Probation: 2 Years, may be transferred to Illinois
Conditions of Probation:
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
No contact with Shawna P. Zachary K. Joshua O. Travis S. or any pawn shops# .
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
No Use or Possession of illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia;
Sign Medical Release for Agent;
Condition Time: 60 days jail, last 40 days STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion

Restitution: to be paid 
$120.00 Pawn America
$46.50 Media X-change
COSTS:  $268.00 
DNA Surcharge: $250.00 
Court orders all cashbail be reinstated and be applied towards restitutuion and costs.  
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program
Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  
Expunction denied.
